turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: My wife.

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: What's it like?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Like waking. Like you always just woke up.							 *

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: That must suck. All... backwards.				 *

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: How long have I been here?

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Couple days.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: So you're holding my calls?

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: As requested.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What makes you think he's my friend?

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Seen you together, that's all.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: He's not my friend, Burt. But if he calls, or if he turns up here, then you give me a call in my room, okay?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I'm sorry, I think I'm checked in here, But I've misplaced my key.

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Hi, Leonard.

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Shit. Wrong room.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: This isn't your room. You're in 304. I Fucked up.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: This isn't my room?

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: No, let's go.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Then why is this my handwriting?

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: This was your room. You're up in 304 now.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: When was I in here?

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Last week. Then I rented you another one On top of this.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Business is slow. I told my boss about You, about your condition. He told me to Try and rent you another room.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why didn't you clean it out?					 *

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: You're still paying for it. It's still Your room.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: So how many rooms am I checked into in this dump?

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Just two. So far.							  *

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Well, at least you're being honest about cheating me.

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Yeah, well you're not gonna remember, anyway.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You don't have to be that honest, Burt.

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Leonard.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I'm sorry, I think I'm checked in here, but I've misplaced my key.

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Hi, Leonard.

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Leonard, it's Burt from the front desk.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: I know you said you didn't want any calls...

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: That's right I did, didn't I?

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: Yeah, but there's a call for you from this guy. He's a cop.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: A cop?

turns.speaker: BURT
turns.text: And he says you're gonna wanna hear what he's got to say.							   *

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: * I'm not too good on the phone. I need to		    * look people in the eye when I talk to			  * them.							    *

turns.speaker: DODD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Who did this to you?

turns.speaker: DODD
turns.text: You did.

turns.speaker: DODD
turns.text: I haven't made a strong enough impression.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Don't be too hard on yourself.

turns.speaker: DODD
turns.text: I like your car.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: DODD
turns.text: Where'd you get it?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Interested in buying one?

turns.speaker: DODD
turns.text: I just want you to tell me how you came by that car.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I forget.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Jimmy?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: What the fuck are you doing here?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Do you remember me?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yeah, I remember you.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You Jimmy Grantz?							  *

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Expecting any other Jimmy's out here, Memory Man? Where the fuck's Teddy?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: You're making a big fucking mistake. My associates are not people you want -

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Don't say anything else.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I knew I couldn't trust that fuck -

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Quiet!

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I don't want blood on them.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Wait! Did he tell you what I was bringing?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Strip!

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Look, there's two hundred grand stashed in the car. Just take it!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You think you can bargain with me?!

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Take the money and walk away!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I don't want your fucking money!

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: You don't remember me.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Sorry, I should have explained. You see, I have this condition -

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: You did explain, Lenny.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Please call me Leonard. My wife called me Lenny.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: You told me.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: So you have information for me?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Is that what your little note says?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Must be tough living life according to a few scraps of paper. Mix up your laundry list and your grocery list, you'll be eating your underwear.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You know him?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: No. But the photo on his license looked familiar. I think he's been in the bar before

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Have I told you what this man did?				*

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Then you shouldn't have to ask.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: But even if you get your revenge, you won't remember it. You won't even know it's happened.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: * So I'll take a picture, get a tattoo.			  * 							   * The world doesn't disappear when you			   * close your eyes, does it? My actions			   * still have meaning, even if I can't			    * remember them. My wife deserves				   * vengeance, and it doesn't make any				* difference whether I know about it.			    *

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Tell me about her again.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Because you like to remember her. I want to see you enjoy yourself.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: She was beautiful. Perfect to me -				*

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: I wrote an address in there, too. Might be useful. It's this abandoned place outside of town. I guy I know used to use it for his bigger deals.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Deals?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: It's isolated.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Sounds perfect? What do I owe you?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: I wasn't helping you for money.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: They treating you alright?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Don't remember.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: You know what we have in common?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Sleep okay?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yeah. You?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Guess I don't have to worry about him anymore.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Who is he? What have you got me into?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Calm down. You're not into anything. It was my problem, you offered no help. It's got nothing to do with your investigation.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: That's the problem! How can I find John G. when I don't know what's going on?! How did you get me into this?!

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Leonard, you offered to help when you saw what this guy did to me.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: How do I know he did that to you?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: I came to you straight after he did it. I showed you what he'd done and asked for your help.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: So I just take your word?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Something feels wrong. I think someone's fucking with me. Trying to get me to kill the wrong guy.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Did you?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Kill him.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Course not.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: You decided to help me. Trust yourself. Trust your own judgment. You can question everything, you can never know anything for sure.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: There are things you know for sure.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Such as?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I know the feel of the world.  I know how this wood will sound when I knock.  I know how this glass will feel when I pick it up.  Certainties. You think it's knowledge, but it's a kind of memory, a kind you take for granted. I can remember so much.  I know the feel of the world,  and I know her.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Your wife?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: She's gone and the present is trivia, which I can scribble down as notes.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: It's not easy to be calm when -

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Just relax.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: His name was Jimmy.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: He went to meet somebody and didn't come back.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Who did he go to meet?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What do the police think?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: They don't look too hard for guys like Jimmy.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Kill him.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Maybe I can help you find him. I know a			* lot of people.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Who?! Fuck, Leonard! Dodd! Dodd beat the shit out of me.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: I did exactly what you told me. I went to		   * Dodd and I said that I didn't have				* Jimmy's money, or any drugs, that this Teddy must have taken everything.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: And what did he say?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: He didn't believe me. He said that if I don't get him the money tomorrow he's gonna kill me. Then he started hitting me.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Where is he?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: What are you gonna do?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I'll go see him.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Give him some bruises of his own and tell him to look for a guy called Teddy.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: He'll kill you, Lenny.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: My wife used to call me Lenny.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yeah, I hated it.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: This guy's dangerous, let's think of something else.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Me? Why would he be interested in me?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: I told him about your car.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why would you do that?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: He was beating the crap out of me! I had to tell him something!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Somebody's come. Already.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Calls himself Dodd.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What does he want?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Wants to know what happened to Jimmy. And his money. He thinks I have it. He thinks I took it.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Did you?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What's this all about?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: You don't know, do you? You're blissfully ignorant, aren't you?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I have this condition -

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: What happened is that Jimmy went to meet a guy called Teddy. He took a lot of money with him and he didn't come back. Jimmy's partners think I set him up. I don't know whether you know this Teddy or how well -

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Neither do I.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Don't protect him.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I'm not.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Help me.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Get rid of Dodd for me.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Kill him. I'll pay you.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What do you think I am?! I'm not gonna kill someone for money.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: What then? Love? What would you kill for? For your wife, right?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: That's different.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Don't talk about my wife.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: I can talk about whoever the fuck I want! You won't even remember what I say! I can tell you that your wife was a fucking whore and we can still be friends!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Calm down.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: That's easy for you to say! You can't get scared, you don't remember how, you fucking idiot!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Just take it easy, this isn't my fault.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Maybe it is! How the fuck would you know?! You don't know a fucking thing! You can't get scared, can you get angry?!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: You pathetic piece of shit. I can say whatever the fuck I want and you won't have a clue, you fucking retard.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Shut the fuck up!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Don't say another fucking word!

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: About your whore of a wife?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: * Depends on if he's here in town. Or if he's moved on. See, I've got all this -			*

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Can I ask you something?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: They're not looking for him.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: How did they explain what you remembered? The gun and stuff?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: * John G. was clever. He took the dead man's gun and replaced it with the sap that he'd hit me with. He left my gun and left the getaway car. He gave the police a complete package. They found a sap with my blood on it in the dead man's hand, and they only found my gun. They didn't need to look for anyone else. I was the only guy who disagreed with the facts, and I had brain damage.						 *

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: You can stay here for a couple of days if it'll help.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: On the house.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: My wife.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Sweet.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Dying.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I remember my wife dying.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Beer, please.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: A BEER, please.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Don't just waltz in here dressed like			  * that and order a beer.						  *

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: There's a dress code?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: What are you here for?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I'm meeting someone called Natalie.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Well, that's me.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Oh. But haven't we met before?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: You tell me.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I don't remember. See, I have no short-			* term memory. It's not amnesia -				   *

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: You're the memory guy?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: How do you know about me?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: My boyfriend told me about you.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Who's your boyfriend?

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Jimmy Grantz. Know him?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Chronic alcoholism ~ one cause of short term memory loss.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Are you Teddy?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: My name's Leonard.							 *

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: Did Teddy send you?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I don't know. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: You have no idea where you've just come from? What you've just done?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I can't make new memories. Everything			  * fades, nothing sticks. By the time we finish this conversation I won't remember how it started, and the next time I see you I won't know that I've ever met you before.

turns.speaker: NATALIE
turns.text: So why did you come here?

turns.speaker: MRS. JANKIS
turns.text: Mr. Shelby, you know all about Sammy and you decided that he was faking -

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Mrs. Jankis, the company's position isn't that Sammy is "faking" anything, just that his condition can't be shown -

turns.speaker: MRS. JANKIS
turns.text: I'm not interested in the company position, Mr. Shelby. I want to know your honest opinion about Sammy.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: We shouldn't even be talking this way while the case is still open to appeal.

turns.speaker: MRS. JANKIS
turns.text: I'm not appealing the decision.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Then why are you here?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Mrs. Jankis, what do you want from me?

turns.speaker: MRS. JANKIS
turns.text: I want you to forget the company you work for for thirty seconds, and tell me if you really think that Sammy is faking his condition.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I believe that Sammy should be physically capable of making new memories.

turns.speaker: MRS. JANKIS
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: She seemed to leave happy. I thought I'd helped her.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: How can you read that again?

turns.speaker: LEONARD'S WIFE
turns.text: It's good.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You've read it a hundred times.

turns.speaker: LEONARD'S WIFE
turns.text: I enjoy it.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yeah, but the pleasure of a book is in wanting to know what happens next -

turns.speaker: LEONARD'S WIFE
turns.text: Don't be a prick. I'm not reading it to annoy you, I enjoy it. Just let me read, please.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Beg my forgiveness! Beg my wife's forgiveness before I blow your brains out!

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Leonard, you don't have a clue what's going on. You don't even know my name.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Teddy!

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I'm Leonard Shelby, I'm from San Francisco and I'm -

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: That's who you were, you don't know who you are.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Shut your mouth!

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Lemme take you down in the basement and show you what you've become.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Did you? I musta forgot. I'm Teddy.			    *

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I guess I've told you about my condition.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: This is your car.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You're in a playful mood.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: What the hell you want to go there for?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You know it?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Yeah, it's just this fucked-up building.		    * Why are we going there?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I don't remember.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Yup?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Mr Gammell?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Lenny, is that you?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: John Gammell?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Lenny, it's Teddy. Look, stay there, okay? I'm gonna be right over.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I'll be waiting.							   *

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Unfinished business. What made you think I wasn't coming back?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: You said you were leaving town.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Things change.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: So I see. It's good to see you. My name's Teddy.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Guess I've told you about my condition.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Only every time I see ya! Come on, I'll buy you lunch.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: It's my condition. I never know if I've already eaten, so I always just eat small amounts.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: You don't have to remember to be hungry.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: It's weird, but if you don't eat for a while then your body stops being hungry. You get sort of shaky but you don't realize you haven't eaten. Have I told you about Sammy Jankis?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Yeah, yeah. I heard enough about him. Tell me about John G. You still think he's here, right?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: The guy you're looking for, Johnny G. That's why you haven't left. Am I right?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Well, the other day you made it sound like you thought somebody might be trying to set you up. Get you to kill the wrong guy.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yeah, well I go on facts, not recommendations, okay?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Lenny, you can't trust a man's life to your little notes and pictures.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: You really want to find this guy?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: He took away the woman I love and he took away my memory. He destroyed everything; my life and my ability to live.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: You're living.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Just for revenge. That's what keeps me going. It's all I have.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Discount Inn. Don't know what room; haven't got my key.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Probably left it in your room.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why are you here?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: You called me. You wanted my help. You know, Lenny, I've had more rewarding friendships than this one. Although I do get to keep using the same jokes.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You don't know him?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: No! Should I?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Think so? You don't know? Didn't you write it down?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I might have fallen asleep before I did.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: I'm not gonna help you kill this guy, if that's what -

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: No. No, just let me think for a minute.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Natalie? Natalie who?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: We've got to get him out of here.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: He's got to have a car, right? We just take him back to his car and tell him to get the fuck out of town before we kill him.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: We can't just walk him out tied up and bleeding.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: How'd ya get him in here in the first place?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: It must be his. I don't think they'd let someone like me carry a gun.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Fucking hope not.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: We probably ought to take his car, you know, teach him a lesson.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Shut it, Teddy.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Easy for you to say, you've got the Jag.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I'll ride with him. You follow.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Give me your keys.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: So was he scared?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yeah. I think it was your sinister mustache that got him.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Fuck you. We shoulda taken his car.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What's wrong with this one?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: You like it? Let's trade.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: So what are you gonna do now?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I'm gonna ask Natalie what the fuck that was all about.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Natalie who?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Who the fuck are you?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Teddy. Your buddy.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Prove it.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Sammy. Remember Sammy. You told me about Sammy.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Unfinished business.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Lenny, as a buddy, let me inform you. Your business here is very much finished. You're still here because of Natalie.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Who's she?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why's that?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Because she'll have taken one look at your clothes and your car and started thinking of ways to turn the situation to her advantage. She's already got you staying with her, for fuck's sake.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What do you mean "bad news"?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: She's involved with these drug dealers.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: She's gonna use you. To protect herself.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: From who?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Guys who'll come after her. Guys who'll want to know what happened to her boyfriend. They'll want to make somebody pay. Maybe she'll try and make it you.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yeah, well maybe she'll make it you. Is that it? You worried she'll use me against you?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: She couldn't.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why not?  MEMENTO Blue Revisions - 8/27/99

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: She has no idea who I am.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why are you following me?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: I'm trying to help you. I knew she'd get her claws into you. She doesn't know anything about your investigation, so when she offers to help you, it'll be for her own reasons. Why would I lie? Do not go back to her. Take out a pen, write yourself a note, do not trust her.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Happy now?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: I won't be happy until you leave town.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: How long do you think you can hang around here before people start asking questions?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: What sort of questions?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: The sort of questions you should be asking yourself.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Like how'd you get this car? That suit?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I have money.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: My wife's death. I used to work in Insurance, we were well covered.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: So in your grief you wandered into a Jaguar dealership?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yes, I do. I don't have amnesia. I remember everything about myself up until the incident. I'm Leonard Shelby, I'm from San Fran -

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: That's who you were, Lenny. You don't know who you are, who you've become since the incident. You're wandering around, playing detective... and you don't even know how long ago it was.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: I didn't sell -

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: I know, you investigated. Maybe you need to apply some of your investigative skills to yourself.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Yeah, well, thanks for the advice.

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Don't go back in there. There's a motel out of town.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: How'd you know I was in here?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: The Jaguar's out front. You didn't even Bother to put it around back.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Why? Come on, Leonard, we talked about this. It's not safe f or you to be walking around like this.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: Envelopes?							    *

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: He knows you're no good on the phone, so		    * he calls you up to bullshit you.				  * Sometimes you stop taking his calls, so			* he slips something under your door to			  * frighten you into answering your phone			 * again. He's been pretending to help you.		    * Feeding you a line of crap about John G.		    * being some local drug dealer.					*

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: How do you know this?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: 'Cos he fucking told me. He thinks it's funny. He's laughing at you.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: How do you know him?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: I'm a snitch. He's a cop from out of town looking for information. The local boys put us in touch.

turns.speaker: LEONARD
turns.text: You're not coming?

turns.speaker: TEDDY
turns.text: Wouldn't be appropriate.						*
